claim: Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain vs 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.
explanation: A scanned page showing the full prescribing information for Flublok, including a table of contents listing sections (Indications and Usage; Dosage and Administration; Dosage Forms and Strengths; Contraindications; Warnings and Precautions; Adverse Reactions; Use in Specific Populations; Description; Clinical Pharmacology; Nonclinical Toxicology; Clinical Studies; References; How Supplied/Storage and Handling; Patient Counseling Information). The Dosage Forms and Strengths section header is visible, along with a note that Flublok is an injection administered as a single 0.5 mL dose. The image does not provide any specific information on hemagglutinin (HA) micrograms per strain in Flublok or a comparison to standard-dose influenza vaccines, so it does not support the claim Note: The relevant dosage details may be on a portion of the table not shown or cut off in the image; text is partially cropped and lacks numeric HA information
